properties.name: Atchison, KS
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily Atchison is about an hour\'s drive away if you head north out of Lawrence on U.S. 59. It\'s a nice winding, manageable drive that\'s perfect if you\'re just looking to get out of town for the day. Best known as the birthplace of Amelia Earhart, the town has a trolley, a college and a number of historical attractions including the Amelia Earhart Museum.Read more.

properties.name: Clinton Overlook and Nature Discovery trail
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily   , , KSThe Clinton Overlook area is a family hiking and picnicking extravaganza that kids of all ages can enjoy. If you are in the mood for an easy hike, or have a toddler with limited stamina, Nature\'s Way...A Discovery Trail, located right behind the Clinton Visitor\'s Center, is a good bet. Read more.

properties.name: Gobug
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily7917 Santa Fe Drive, Overland Park, KS 66204Big style for little adventures | Featuring hip playwear and gear for kids of modern, active parents. Sizes for newborns to size 6.

properties.name: Lawrence Gymnastics Academy Open Gym
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily   4930 Legends Dr, Lawrence, KSTired of asking your kids to stop jumping off the furniture? A visit to open gym at the Lawrence Gymnastic Academy should mellow them out. At this open gym, kids have free run of all LGA\'s equipment which includes: trampolines of various sizes, rings, bars, balance beams, and of course, a big pit of foam. If you have little ones who aren\'t used to hanging with the big kids, there is a four and under session on Fridays that is fairly tame.

properties.name: Madame Hatter's Tea Room
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily   702 Main St, Eudora, KSNo matter how old you are, it\'s hard to resist a great trunk of fancy dress-up clothes. That\'s why it is not uncommon to find grown women and little kids rummaging side by side through the impressive vault of hats, boas, jewels, and purses in the vault at Madame Hatter\'s in Eudora. Fun is definitely the theme at this Tea Room, and finding the right outfit in which to have your tea is central to the experience.Read more.

properties.name: Open Gym at the Community Building
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily   115. W. 11th St. Little tykes do a lot better when they\'ve had a chance to run off their ya-yas. Winter can make this challenging to accomplish. The toddler open gym at the Community Building is warm, cheap, (historically ) and centrally located.Read more.

properties.name: Pet World
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily   711 W 23rd St, Lawrence, KSLooking for an animal fix, but not quite up for the zoo? Take the family to Pet World. Sure, it\'s just a pet store, but between the giant tortoises, the talking birds, the gallery of reptiles, the aquarium room, and the furry rabbits, it\'s easy to spend an hour just looking around.Read more.

properties.name: Prairie Park Nature Center
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily  2730 Harper Street Lawrence, KansasThe exhibits at the nature center are lively enough that older kids find it entertaining, and the center is small enough to be ideal for a toddler outing. When the weather is nice, you can explore the nature trails around the center, and play on the new giant climbing boulder. During the dead of winter, enjoy the view from the playroom while the kids look through books or put on a puppet show. Admission to the center is free.Read more.

properties.name: Rudy's Pizzeria
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily  704 Massachusetts Lawrence, KSThis is not an ad. We at FSF receive no money from Rudy\'s Pizzeria and have no financial ties to the place except that on occasion we drop a few bucks there. That said, Rudy\'s is one the best things about living in Lawrence, and you should take the kids there next time you get the chance, ideally on a Wednesday. Read more.

properties.name: Sun Fire Ceramics
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily  1002 New Hampshire St, Lawrence, KSSun Fire Ceramics is a "paint-it-yourself" studio that allows you to pick an item (a mug, plate, statue, mirror, etc.), paint it, and leave it behind to be fired and picked up a few days later. It\'s worth doing, if for no other reason than it gives the kids a chance to take pride in something they\'ve created. It also supports a local business that\'s been a staple of the downtown scene for nearly a decade. But parents, if you\'re going to go, you should know what you\'re getting into. Read more.

properties.name: The Deanna Rose Farm
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily   13800 Switzer Road, Overland Park, KSThe Deanna Rose Children\'s Farmstead is basically a park to beat all parks. The 12-acre farm, which was named in honor of an Overland Park police officer who was killed in the line of duty in 1985, offers the opportunity to observe and feed a variety of animals, and has a fishing pond stocked with hybrid bluegill and catfish. There are several playgrounds throughout the farm, and a garden area maintained by the Johnson County Extension Master Gardeners. Read more.

properties.name: The Henrys' Plant farm
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily  248 N 1700th Rd, Lecompton, KSIn the way of animals, you\'ll find some friendly burros to pet, a big pig or two, some horses, and a pasture of sheep. There is also a coop full of chickens, turkeys, and ducks, as well as the odd peacock running around. The display gardens include ponds with fish and frogs, a garden in the shape of a butterfly, and plenty of room for everyone to roam, explore, and relax. Read more.

properties.name: The Kansas Museum of History
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily   6425 SW Sixth Ave., Topeka KSIf you\'re not a history buff, a visit to the Kansas Museum of History in Topeka may not be very high on your list of things to do. It\'s time to revise that list. The Kansas Museum of History has enough to keep a family entertained for the better part of the day. Before even entering the building, kids can play on the large play structure that is fashioned after a grain elevator. A winding staircase leads to the top of the elevator where a series of slides then leads them into the bed of a pick-up truck. Read more.

properties.name: The Lawrence Visitors Center
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily 2nd and Locust Lawrence KSWhile going to the visitors center in your own town may seem silly, and perhaps a bit dull, the Lawrence Visitors Center is a perfectly suitable destination for families with toddlers and preschoolers who need a simple excursion. Read more.

properties.name: The Sensory Garden
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily   1120 W. 11th St., Lawrence KSBy Karen Matheis One Saturday morning, I happened to take a different route on a morning run. I noticed a quaint and tidy little garden off to the side of Audio Reader that I hadn\'t ever seen. What an interesting find. The garden is not very large, but contains many different types of plants that are labeled to include Braille. Although all can enjoy the garden, it is designed for non-seeing and non-hearing people in mind. Visitors can feel the textures of the plants that are near a hand\'s touch and hear or feel the wind chimes that have different tones. Read more.

properties.name: The T-Rex Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily   1843 Village West Parkway, Kansas City, KSWho needs Vegas? Complete sensory overload is just 45 minutes away! Read more.

properties.name: The Topeka Zoo
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily   635 Sw Gage Blvd, Topeka, KSGigantic, destination zoos that take all day to explore (ala the Kansas City Zoo) have their place, and are undoubtedly impressive. However, anyone who has every visited one of these big-daddy zoos with young kids knows that enough is enough. Acres of simulated African savanah are great for the lions, but they\'re hell to trek through with tired kids on a hot day.Read more.

properties.name: The Toy and Miniature Museum
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily  5235 Oak Street, Kansas City, MODo you ever find yourself painstakingly dressing your children\'s Polly Pockets, or carefully arranging a tiny place setting for a group of Calico Critters, and think, "damn, this is fun?" If so, you should consider getting yourself over to the Toy and Miniature Museum of Kansas City. Read more.

properties.name: Theater for Young America
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily 30 W. Pershing Rd. , Kansas City, MOTheater for Young America\'s performances at Union Station\'s City Stage are an example of children\'s theater at its best. The plays involve both professional actors and children from Theater for Young America\'s drama classes. Read more.

properties.name: Wonderscope
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily  5705 Flint St. Shawnee, KSIf you\'re looking for a fun and educational way to spend the day, Wonderscope Children\'s Museum is a good bet. Wonderscope is housed in an old elementary school, and each classroom is full of hands-on activities that fall under a distinct theme. One room is set up like a hospital, one is grocery store, one has a nature theme, etc. Read more.
